WER SIND WIR?
Wir sind Schüler*innen, Azubis, Studierende und junge Menschen aus Stuttgart, welche Freitags auf die Straße gehen um gegen die Klimapolitik zu streiken.

WAS MACHEN WIR?
Am Freitag, 21.12.18 streiken wir ab 11 Uhr vor dem Rathaus. Wir möchten uns auf den Boden setzen und Schilder mit Botschaften zum Umweltschutz halten.

WANN STREIKEN WIR?
11 Uhr: Streik und Kundgebung vor dem Rathaus

WO STREIKEN WIR?
Vor dem Rathaus

WAS KANN ICH MITBRINGEN?
Wir haben schon einige Schilder, die wir allen zur Verfügung stellen. Wenn ihr möchtet, könnt ihr gerne eigene mitbringen.
Um Passant*innen nicht nur einen Denkanstoß, sondern auch Informationen mit auf den Weg zu geben, könnt ihr gerne Flyer mitbringen.
Damit uns nicht sofort kalt wird, nehmen wir ein paar Unterlagen mit, auf die wir uns setzen können, eigene sind auch gern gesehen. Außerdem könnt ihr für euch selbst Tee mitbringen.
Falls du eine Digitalkamera hast kannst du diese mitbringen.
Am wichtigsten sind natürlich viele Aktivist*innen. Teilt diese Veranstaltung mit Befreundeten, Mitschüler*innen etc.

Wenn ihr nicht aus Stuttgart kommt, aber trotzdem gerne für das Klima streiken würdet, könnt ihr uns gerne kontaktieren, sodass wir euch mit anderen Menschen in eurer Region vernetzen können.

Falls du Interesse hast, öfters an Streiks und anderen Demonstrationen in Stuttgart zum Thema Umweltschutz teilzunehmen, kannst du gerne unserer Gruppe auf Facebook beitreten: https://m.facebook.com/groups/507670773061801/?ref=bookmarks

Bei weiteren Fragen, könnt ihr uns gerne eine Nachricht schreiben.

#fridaysforfuture #climatejusticenow #fridaysforfuturestuttgart #stuttgart

24th may 2019 students and youths from Mumbai, went on a global climate strike at Juhu Beach... The climate strike initiated by @gretathunberg and @fridaysforfutureindia_
to demand environmental justice... We lost 49655 species of Flora and fauna in past years i.e  One species every 10 minutes is lost... We have less than 4 years of timespan left to control this destructive impacta of global warming and climate change,beyond this timespan our species would enter the extinction era.. Conservation of green spaces natural ecosystems would be prime need but sadly in  Mumbai the already less left i.e 13% of green cover is being rapidly opened up.for projects...
While the most worrying consiquencies of global warming is the rising sea levels due to melting of glaciers. 
If the sea levels rise up rapidly then Mumbai and the other coastal cities face the threat of submerging. 
Hence Dear PMO Narendra Modi
Since you would be leading the nation for next five years you hold a huge responsibility towards the the future generations... The country may either appreciate or blame you rigoursly for your good/bad decisions towards environment.
We need immediate actions to be taken to cater global and climate crisis.

#CostaRica is in the top 5 of countries that are leading the way into renewable resources. It might seem small but it has a really big environmental impact. Since 2014 the country’s energy has been coming from 99% renewable sources, and it has been running on 100% renewable energy for over two months twice in the last two years. Then, since June 2017 they have been set on eradicating single-use plastic by 2021. The first be the first country in the world to do this. And most recently, in the summer of 2018, the country announced its aims to become completely carbon-neutral by the year 2021 – The first completely carbon-free country in the whole world.

Delhi’s citizens are protesting against Government's inaction to avert a climate breakdown. Scientists have clearly said that we need to act now to prevent average temperature rise beyond 1.5C.  They have clearly said we need to stop burning fossil fuels, reduce our consumption and change the way we produce food. Drastic measures are needed today to avoid future catastrophe. Greta Thunberg, 16 year old student in Sweden, was the first to starkly voice her anger at the denial of adults to recognize the state of emergency. Her strike from school demanding action has ignited similar strikes in over 270 locations all around the world. Indian children joined the global strike on March 15th and April 12th.  On May 24th Students and  the public will demand its right to clean air and safe road travel. 
Children & youth of New Delhi join citizens in the global strike for future, Extinction Rebellion & Fridays For Future to reclaim their space for footpath & cycle path.... As per scientific studies vehicles are responsible for one third of Delhi’s hazardous particulate matter and a third of its greenhouse gas emissions. To clean Delhi's air we need to reduce the number of vehicles on the road. However current policies and development plans are not in accordance with the concept of Sustainable Mobility, where cities are designed for pedestrians and non-motorised vehicles like Cycles. 
To help clean Delhi's air Children, students and workers have the following demand for their elected government:
- No more money be spent on expanding roads that cater primarily to private motor vehicles. It should be used to ensure safe and frequent road crossing facilities and access through traffic signals and  all gated colonies.
- Use of motor vehicles should be discouraged through congestion charges, parking fees and car-free zones.
- PWD, GNTCD, DDA and other relevant authorities should assess each square kilometre to ensure proper footpaths & dedicated cycling paths. All the bus stops and metro stations are easily accessible by all individuals.
- Reduce metro fares and provide students discounts as well as off-peak rates.  GNTCD allow the use of student passes on cluster buses.
-

İngiliz İşçi Partisi’nin iklimsel bir acil durum ilan etme teklifinin ardından, İskoçya başbakanı Nicola Sturgeon iklimsel bir acil durum ilan etti.

Eylemcilik işe yarıyor.
O halde, eyleme geç.

Arkadaşlarımızdan 9.5 yaşındaki Rüya Aygüneş Milli Eğitim Bakanı Ziya Selçuk’a seslendi: ‘Ziya Amca Küresel Isınmaya Dur De’ Milliyet Gazetesi haberi ☺️ (eng) Our 9.5 years old friend Rüya Aygüneş has called out to Minister of Education Ziya Selcuk by saying "Uncle Ziya please say stop to climate change"

Rüya’nın Bakan Ziya Selçuk’a mektubu: “Adım Rüya Aygüneş. 9,5 yaşındayım. Size bu mektubu yazmamın sebebi iklim krizini çok önemsemem ve bu sorunla ilgili bir şeyler yapmanızı istememdir. Belki iklim krizi sorununun ne olduğunu bilmiyor olabilirsiniz. Size kısaca iklim krizi nedir anlatayım. İklim krizi dünyayı yok edebilecek ve biz çocukların geleceğini etkileyen şeydir. Peki nasıl etkiliyor? Bizim her zaman yaptığımız araba kullanmak, doğalgaz kullanmak, kömür yakmak gibi şeyler dünyaya karbondioksit salıyor. Bunun sonucunda dünya ısınıyor. Isınma sonucunda tarım alanlarına su basıyor, kuraklık oluşuyor ve buzullar çok hızlı eriyor. Hortum gibi şeylerin çıkmayacağı yerlerde hortum çıkıyor. Doğal afet değil insan afeti ortaya çıkıyor.

Bunları bana Greta Thunberg düşündürdü. Greta da benim gibi iklim kriziyle baş etmeye çalışıyor. İklim krizini okulda derslerde gördüğü için biliyor. Ama Türkiye’de böyle bir ders yok. İklim krizi bana evim yanıyormuş gibi, bir geleceğim olmayacakmış, canlıların sonu gelecekmiş gibi hissettiriyor. İnsanlara derdimi anlatmak için sizden yardım almam gerek. Ziya Selçuk Amca, sizden istediğim iklim krizi okullarda derk olarak anlatılsın. Sizinle görüştüğümde sizi ikna edeceğimden eminim.” #iklimdegisikligi #iklimkrizi #fridaysforfuture @gretathunberg @fridaysforfutureglobal @temavakfi

@gretathunberg diyor ki; “Bugün #otizmfarkındalıkgünü Spektrumda olmaktan gurur duyuyorum!

Hayır, otizm bir “armağan” değildir (tıpkı ADHD, ADD, Tourette, OCD, ODD ve diğerlerinin de olmadığı gibi). Çoğu zaman, okullara, işyerlerine ve zorbalara karşı verilen sonu gelmez bir mücadeledir. Ama doğru koşullar altında ve doğru düzenlemelerle, bir süper güç OLABİLİR. 
Ben de depresyonlardan, yabancılaşmadan, kaygı ve diğer bozukluklardan üstüme düşen payı aldım. Ama teşhisim olmasaydı, okul grevi yapmaya asla başlayamazdım. Çünkü o zaman ben de herkes gibi olurdum.
Toplumlarımızın değişmeye ihtiyacı var, bizim de geniş bir perspektiften bakan insanlara. Birbirimize özen göstermeye artık başlamalıyız. Farklılıklarımızı kucaklamaya da.”
#gretasays #aspiepower #autism #AutismAwarenessDay #otizmemaviışıkyak #2nisanotizmfarkındalıkgünü

@gretathunberg diyor ki; “ Bir çok liderle görüşmelerim sonrasında iklim krizinin kontrol altına alındığını, aciliyetin farkında olduklarını ve hemen harekete geçeceklerini fark ettim. 
Bu yüzden bugünden itibaren okul grevi yapmamaya ve okula dönmeye karar verdim. Cumaları bundan böyle okul grevi olmayacak. “

@gretathunberg diyor ki;
Mozambik’in eski “first lady”si ve önde gelen hümanistlerinden Graça Machel, verdiği bir röportajda, kasırganın en şiddetli vurduğu bildirilen Beira şehri için “iklim değişikliğinin yerle bir ettiği ilk şehir olarak tarihe geçecek,” demiş. Birleşmiş Milletler tarafından “Güney Yarıküre tarihinin en kötü hava felaketi” olarak nitelendirilen kasırgada yüzlerce insan hayatını kaybetti. İklim yıkımı şimdi, hemen şu anda gerçekleşiyor. Eziyetini çekenlerinse çok büyük çoğunluğu, bu krize yol açacak hiçbir şey yapmamış olan insanlar. Mozambik’te kişi başına düşen karbondioksit emisyon miktarı yılda 0.3 ton. Bizim İsveç’te kişi başına 10 tonun üstünde emisyonumuz var. ABD’de bu değer kişi başına 16 tonu aşıyor. Hepimiz değişmeye mecburuz. Bazılarımız daha çok mecbur… #iklimadaleti #iklimyıkımı #climatejustice #climatebreakdown #mozambique

Açık Radyo iklim değişikliğinin resmini çizmeleri için Çocukları çağırıyor:

Çocuklar iklimin gidişatından derinlemesine kaygılı. Yeryüzünün karşı karşıya bulunduğu en büyük tehlike olan iklim felaketine doğru dörtnala gidilen bir ortamda, onlar da iklim krizi ve çareleri üzerine duyduklarını ve düşündüklerini resme döküyor: Ana okullu, ilkokullu, orta okullu, liseli çocuklar ve gençler çizimler, resimler, tasarımlar, illüstrasyonlar ve kolajlar hazırlıyor. Açık Gazete, her Perşembe ve Cuma, çağrısına kulak veren çocukların isimlerini duyuruyor, Açık Radyo da gönderilen resimleri internet sitesinde düzenli olarak sergiliyor.
Resimlerinizi gönderebilmeniz için mail adresi: ikliminresmi@gmail.com

firstComment:
Direkt nach dem globalen Streik geht es Samstag weiter, denn die @parents4future laden ein: Rote Linie auch in Essen!
Wir, Stadt Essen, Deutschland, Europa - wir müssen alle zusammen die Klimakrise stoppen! Lasst uns eine rote Menschenkette nun auch das erste Mal in Essen bilden, damit wir in rot daran erinnern können, dass uns die Zeit zu echten Entscheidungen zum Klimaschutz abläuft und dass eine Energiewende passieren muss.
Wir erinnern mit Trommeln und Rhythmus daran, dass wir eine Stimme haben - für unsere Erde! #VoteClimate bei der Europawahl am 26. Mai! 
Und in Essen läuft der Film "Die Rote Linie"! Noch ein Grund mehr, uns auf der Straße zu zeigen!
Unterstützt werden wir von den @scientists4future , von den @krit_aktionaere, vom Rute und musikalisch von Les héritiers Du Vieux Coca!
Kommt in ROT und bringt Trommeln und Musikinstrumente mit!
@ende__gelaende @extinctionrebelliondeutschland @fridaysforfuturedeutschland @solifuerhambi  #fridaysforfuture #europawahl #klimawahl #rotelinie #hambibleibt #alledörferbleiben #rausausrwe #irrwegestoppen #stadtessen #hambacherforst #kohleausstieg #gretathunberg #weareunstoppable #demonstration

firstComment:
MORGEN ist RWE Hauptversammlung und daher laufen wir um 10.30 Uhr gemeinsam von der Grugahalle bis zum RWE Campus! ✊🌳
Wollen wir uns als Spezies selbst ausrotten, weil wir nicht rechtzeitig aufgehört haben, Millionen Jahre alte Kohle aus dem Boden zu holen, um sie für Strom zu verbrennen? 🤯 
Deutschland fördert weltweit am meisten Braunkohle und RWE ist das größte deutsche Braunkohleunternehmen!
Daher müssen wir die #irrwegestoppen ✖️ #kohletötet #hambibleibt #alledörferbleiben #kohleausstieg 2030 #klimaretten #kohlestopp #fridaysforfuture #essenforfuture #klimastreik #gretathunberg #rausausrwe #rwe #diein #stromanbieterwechsel #erneuerbareenergie #braunkohle #keepitintheground #arminlasset #hambacherforst #tagebau #revier #systemchange not #climatechange #wespoke #ffffordert #actnow 
@krit_aktionaere @fridaysforfuture.de @solifuerhambi @hambachfrau @hambacherforst @buirer @ende__gelaende @fossilfreedeutschland @extinctionrebelliondeutschland

firstComment:
Am 3.5 treffen wir uns um 10.30 vor der Grugahalle.#irrwegestoppen 
Diese Woche Freitag, picknickten wir auf dem Kennedy-Platz. Es war eine sehr stimmungsvoll Demonstration und das anschließende Picknick war für alle ein guter Ort sich besser kennen zu lernen und ein zweites Frühstück zu genießen. 
Die Brötchen haben wir von @doebbe_baeckereien bekommen, diese wären sonst wieder zurück geschickt worden. @sattgruen unterstützte unsere Idee, von einem nachhaltigen Frühstück  und gab uns die Reste des Tages, welche sonst im Müll gelandet wären. Gerettetes Essen schmeckt doch gleich viel besser! 
Danke dafür! 
Und auch Danke an die @parents4future welche uns diese Woche sehr unterstützt haben.🌳❤️
📸 Florian Ziegler

Diesen Samstag den 30.3 um 20.30-21.30 findet die #eathhour statt. 
Traditionell wird als Zeichen für den Klimawandel das Licht ausgeknipst. 
Wie kannst du mitmachen? 
Zuhause das Licht ausknipsen oder 
mit andern (jungen)Menschen durch die Stadt laufen (z.b Düsseldorf oder Oberhausen) 
Weitere Infos folgen dazu in der Story. 🌳📸

*info für Freitag*
Wir treffen uns um 9:15 am #WillyBrandtPlatz um ein wenig in #Stimmung zu kommen und uns zu koordinieren. Wir *fahren dann gemeinsam* nach *Düsseldorf* .Alle die ein *Ticket* haben *bringen das bitte mit*. firstComment:
Danke @reconquistanetz für diese wunderbare Verschmelzung zweier Symbole! 
Greta schreibt heute zum #weltfrauentag: " .Nowhere in the world today women and men are equal. And that is a fact. Just look at who own the money and who are the ones in power. Still today we have a long way to equality. And we have to acknowledge that. .The more I learn about the climate crisis the more I realise how crucial feminism is. There are many studies showing that men emit more than women on average. And that women are the ones who are going to be most effected by the climate crisis.
We can not live in a sustainable world unless all genders and people are being treated equally. Period."
@gretathunberg @fridaysforfuture.de @liberationessen

firstComment:
‼️ *Infos zum 08.03*
Wir treffen uns um #10h wie immer am #WillyBrandtPlatz.
Wir haben etwas größeres geplant und dafür brauchen wir #alleMenschen die irgendwie Zeit haben. Also aktiviert eure Netzwerke, Familien, Freunde, Vereine, Klassen, Studiengänge etc.

Des Weiteren suchen wir noch 10 Leute als Bannerteam. Diese Menschen können leider nicht am gesamten Streik teilnehmen bei Interesse bitte eine dm schreiben.

Lasst uns das Event am Freitag zum größten Streik seit langem in Essen machen. Nur gemeinsam können wir das schaffen. Also mobilisiert fleißig und bis Freitag 💚✊

firstComment:
‼️‼️EILMELDUNG‼️‼️
Am *12.3.2019* wird Levi von #FridaysforFuture  Essen im Umweltausschuss der Stadt Essen eine Rede halten, nachdem der Stadtrat für ein Rederecht negativ abgestimmt hat. Wir laden euch alle herzlich ein am *Dienstag, den 12.3.2019 um 14:30* den #Umweltausschuss zu besuchen, Sitzungsort ist der *Ratssaal im Rathaus in Essen* .
Wir würden uns über möglichst viel Unterstützung freuen, bringt gerne Plakate mit, damit klar wird, wer ihr seid! Gerade in Essen ist so etwas wichtig, da hier RWE, E.on und co sitzen!
Wir freuen uns auf euch!
Teilt das hier gerne mit allen euren Kontakten, damit wir möglichst viele werden!💚🌳🌍‼️

firstComment:
In den letzten Wochen ist unsere Bewegung unglaublich
gewachsen. Wir und unser Protest standen in der Öffentlichkeit. Neben der
positiven Tatsache, dass wir als Aktion enormen Zuwachs bekommen haben, gab es
aber auch vermehrt Anfeindungen und Drohungen gegen uns als Bewegung und
Personen, die uns öffentlich vertreten. Sei es der Hass, der öffentlich auf Social Media verbreitet wird oder eine Drohung in privaten Nachrichten, welche bis zur Androhung des Mordes gehen.  Der FfF-Aktivist Jan Ole (16) aus dem Kreis Pinneberg, sagt
dazu: „Der Hass zeigt uns auch, dass wir mit unserer Kritik den Finger in
Wunden, vor allem in konservativen Kreisen der Politik legen.“ Der FfF-Aktivist Vincent (17) aus Kiel, sagt dazu: "Provokationen
und Drohungen werden mich nicht davon abhalten, meine Zukunft zu gestalten und
die Klimakrise zu bekämpfen." Die FfF-Aktivistin Caro (19) aus Tübingen, sagt dazu: „Wir tolerieren weder Hate-Speech noch die
Klimakrise. Kein Hasskommentar der Welt kann uns aufhalten.“ ​Wir als Fridays for Future positionieren uns ganz klar gegen Hass. Wir
stehen für konstruktive und energische Diskurse und Proteste, behandeln uns und
unsere politischen Gegner aber mit Respekt. Selbiges fordern wir auch von
anderen. Deshalb werden wir Hassbotschaften nicht länger tolerieren und strafrechtlich relevante Nachrichten und Kommentare zur Anzeige bringen. @janole.li

#lovespeech #loveforthefuture #loveforclimate #fridaysforfuture #essenforfuture #fridaysforfutureessen #fff #schoolstrike4climate #schulstreikfürsklima #gretathunberg #stopcoal #braunkohleausstieg #kohlekomission #keinkonsens #zukunftskomission #vegansforfuture #hambibleibt #hambacherforstbleibt #climatejustice #klimagerechtigkeit #earthliberation

firstComment:
Die Kampagne @milliondollarvegan bietet Papst Franziskus eine Millionen Dollar als Spende für ein Projekt seiner Wahl, wenn er einen Monat lang vegan lebt. 
Warum? Die Tierindustrie verursacht mehr Emissionen als der gesamte Verkehrssektor zusammen, ist verantwortlich für über 90% der Regenwaldabholzung und verbraucht momentan etwa 2/3 unseres Trinkwassers. 
Deshalb möchten wir auch euch dazu auffordern, zumindest einen Monat lang vegan zu leben. Denn für echten Klimaschutz muss sich nicht nur die Politik verändern. Auch jede*r einzelne von uns sollte versuchen den eigenen Lebensstil so nachhaltig wie möglich zu gestalten! 🌱❤️

Wir hatten Hoffnung und wurden enttäuscht. Die Kohlekommission hat einen Kompromiss gegen unsere Zukunft geschlossen. Für unsere Zukunft braucht es einen Kohleausstieg bis allerspätestens 
2030.
Das Ergebniss ist kein gesellschaftlicher Konsens, denn wir legen ein Veto ein. Nach wie vor setzten wir auf einen Kohleausstieg bis 2030.
(Text von @fridaysforfuture.de) @solifuerhambi @fossilfreedeutschland @ende__gelaende

firstComment:
"Herr Kufen, Stadt Essen, Zukunft nicht vergessen!" – heute treffen wir uns um 15 Uhr vor dem Rathaus, weil dort der Stadtrat tagt und über den Verkauf der RWE Aktien entscheidet!
 Wer heute nicht in #Essen dabei sein kann, schaut die Sitzung live unter: https://www.essen.de/rathaus/rat/ratssitzungen_online.de.html

Was ist zu erwarten? 🤔 🗳️Möglichkeit A: Der Antrag der Grünen wird von der Mehrheit von #CDU und #SPD abgelehnt = ziemlich wahrscheinlich. 🗳️Möglichkeit B: Ein Erfolg wäre es schon, wenn der Antrag an die Verwaltung zu einer Stellungnahme verwiesen wird.

Wie ist der Antrag der Grünen zu bewerten?
Grundsätzlich positiv, weil:
a) der Verkauf der RWE-Beteiligung gefordert wird, damit die Stadt Essen nicht länger mitverantwortlich für die Klimaschädigung durch RWE-Kohle-Stromerzeugung ist
und

b) der Verkaufserlös sinnvoll re-investiert werden soll in städtische Wohnungsbau-Maßnahmen.

Kommt heute um 15 Uhr in Essen zum Rathaus! 🌁

Danke für diese Zusammenfassung @solifuerhambi 
@fridaysforfuture.de @fossilfreedeutschland @essen_ruhr

Am Freitag waren 250 Demonstrierende in der Essener Innenstadt unterwegs! Schüler*innen des St. Ursula Gymnasium Dorsten, der Realschule An der Fleuth, der Essener Waldorfschule und der Hiberniaschule Herne waren vertreten sowie Essener und Bochumer Studierende und engagierte "jung gebliebene" :)
Von diesen Menschen waren die allermeisten das erste Mal beim Klimastreik dabei und viele von ihnen waren zuvor noch nie bei einer Demonstration!

Plusminus 250 junge und alte Menschen waren heute in Essen unterwegs und haben sich den 55 deutschen Städten für die wöchentlichen Klimademos angeschlossen. Ich bin immer noch total beeindruckt, wie viele so laut und gut gelaunt bei der Kälte durch die Stadt gezogen sind. Dafür habe ich sogar gerne all meinen Kram auf dem Schreibtisch liegen lassen, der mich eigentlich echt gestresst hat.
.
About 250 (or more?) young and old people participated in the world wide weekly climate strike inspired by @gretathunberg in Essen, Germany, today. I was SO impressed by the positive energy. It felt so overwhelming to be marching along with many many other people around the world 🌱
.

”Up to a million species face extinction, many within decades.” A new UN report concludes ”the destruction of nature threatens humanity.” Where are the headlines? Where are the emergency meetings?
#EcologicalBreakdown #ClimateBreakdown  Link i bio and on Facebook.

“I am declaring that there is a climate emergency and Scotland will live up to our responsibility to tackle it”
After the British Labour party’s bid to declare a climate emergency, the first minister of Scotland, Nicola Sturgeon, declares a climate emergency. 
These are very hopeful first steps. 
But let us be clear that in a “climate emergency” we need to leave the fossil fuels in the ground.
Activism is working.
So act. 
#climatebreakdown #extinctionrebellion #schoolstrike4climate #fridaysforfuture #climatestrike - picture signed “O- SEKOER” 
EDIT: Now Wales has also declared a climate emergency!!

Second cyclone in 6 weeks hit Mozambique. Entire villages have been wiped out and now there is violent, devastating flooding. It is the people who have done the least to cause #climatebreakdown who are hit the hardest.
So proud of my super talented sister, @beataernman . Listen to her new song on Spotify, link in bio!

One of the most common arguments that we children hear when people criticize us is that "we don't have any solutions"... Here is a part from my speech at the British Parliament: .
.
"Many people say that we don’t have any solutions to the climate crisis. And they are right. Because how could we? How do you “solve” the greatest crisis that humanity has ever faced? How do you “solve” a war? How do you “solve” going to the moon for the first time? How do you “solve” inventing new inventions?
The climate crisis is both the easiest and the hardest issue we have ever faced. The easiest because we know what we must do. We must stop the emissions of greenhouse gases. The hardest because our current economics are still totally dependent on burning fossil fuels, and thereby destroying ecosystems in order to create everlasting economic growth.
“So, exactly how do we solve that?” you ask us – the schoolchildren striking for the climate.

And we say: “No one knows for sure. But we have to stop burning fossil fuels and restore nature and many other things that we may not have quite figured out yet.”
Then you say: “That’s not an answer!”
So we say: “We have to start treating the crisis like a crisis – and act even if we don’t have all the solutions.”
“That’s still not an answer,” you say.
Then we start talking about circular economy and rewilding nature and the need for a just transition. Then you don’t understand what we are talking about.
We say that all those solutions needed are not known to anyone and therefore we must unite behind the science and find them together along the way. But you do not listen to that. Because those answers are for solving a crisis that most of you don’t even fully understand. Or don’t want to understand.
You don’t listen to the science because you are only interested in solutions that will enable you to carry on like before. Like now. And those answers don’t exist any more. Because you did not act in time.
Avoiding climate breakdown will require cathedral thinking. We must lay the foundation while we may not know exactly how to build the ceiling.
Sometimes we just simply have to find a way.”

Today on April 4th is Sweden’s Overshoot Day. This means that Sweden for the rest of 2019 is living outside the planetary boundaries and is stealing (because you don’t “borrow” something you can’t return) the carbon budgets from future generations and people in developing countries. 
The global Overshoot Day is around 1st of August (and it’s getting earlier every year...)
If you live in a rich country with a roughly similar high carbon lifestyle to Sweden, then chances are your overshot day occurs round about now as well. (USA 15 March, Australia 31 March, Canada 18 march, Qatar 19 feb, Germany 2 May, UK may 8, Italy may 24 etc ) 
This must come to an end. 
#climatejustice #overshootday #movethedate

Today is #AutismAwarenessDay . Proud to be on the spectrum!

And no, autism (as well as ADHD, ADD, Tourette’s, OCD, ODD etc) is not a “gift”. For most it is an endless fight against schools, workplaces and bullies. But under the right circumstances, given the right adjustments it CAN be a superpower.
I’ve had my fair share of depressions, alienation, anxiety and disorders. But without my diagnosis, I would never have started school striking. Because then I would have been like everyone else.
Our societies need to change, and we need people who think outside the box and we need to start taking care of each other. And embrace our differences. #aspiepower #autism

Beira, Mozambique, reportedly the hardest hit city, “will go down in history as having been the first city to be completely devastated by climate change,” said Graça Machel, the country’s former first lady and a prominent humanitarian in an interview.  Many, many hundreds are dead in what the United Nations call “the worst weather disaster in history in the Southern Hemisphere”. Climate breakdown is happening now. And the vast majority of those who are suffering have done nothing to cause this crisis. In Mozambique they emit 0,3 tonnes CO2 per capita per year. In Sweden we emit over 10 tonnes. In the USA it’s over 16 tonnes per capita. We must all change. Some of us more than others... #climatejustice #climatebreakdown

Today is International Women’s Day. And today we honour sisterhood.
This is me and my little sister @beataernman when we were younger.
Growing up, we were always the shy girls in the back. Those who didn’t take up much space and who no one noticed. .

Nowhere in the world today women and men are equal. And that is a fact. Just look at who own the money and who are the ones in power. Still today we have a long way to equality. And we have to acknowledge that. .

The more I learn about the climate crisis the more I realise how crucial feminism is. There are many studies showing that men emit more than women on average. And that women are the ones who are going to be most effected by the climate crisis.
We can not live in a sustainable world unless all genders and people are being treated equally. Period.
#feminist #womensday #8march

Six things that happened 2018 that gives me hope in 2019:
.
1. More and more leading scientists are speaking clearly about the emergency of the climate crisis. And people like the UN Secretary General, António Guterres, say that we are facing an existential threat.
.
2. The IPCC report. Even though it’s a huge compromise and a lot of economic interests have much to say, it shows clearly that we need to change everything. “Limiting warming to 1.5°C is possible within the laws of chemistry and physics but doing so would require unprecedented changes”. .
.
3. Emissions are still increasing. Sounds weird...but if the emissions would have gone down by, like, 0,1% everyone would think what we’re doing right now is enough, and then go back to sleep. .
.
4. More and more reports are showing that 10% of the worlds richest people emits 50% of the CO2. And a few companies are responsible for enormous proportions of the  greenhouse gas emissions. In Sweden for instance 3 companies, @hm , @electrolux and @inside_ericsson together  emits more than the whole of Sweden - which moves the debate from the individual level. So that the really big polluters can’t get away with what they are doing.
.
5. All the solutions are already out there. Even if they sometimes mean NOT doing things and simply giving up some of our habits. Like you do in a crisis...
.
6. Movements of resistance are starting and growing everywhere. Like Extinction Rebellion, The Sunrise Movement and many, many others. .
May 2019 be the year when we start to change everything. Happy new year!

My 2018 in one picture: me on the 17 of August making a sign outlining the letters “SKOLSTREJK FÖR KLIMATET”. I had made up my mind. Since that day a lot has changed for me. But nothing would have been possible without other people joining in. The climate crisis we have to fight together. Never be afraid to speak your mind! No one is too small to make a difference. Happy new year! 
#climatestrike #fridaysforfuture #schoolstrike4climate #happynewyear
Thank you @algore for being a true pioneer. Very few people have done more. It was an honour to meet you. #climatecrisis #climatebreakdown

After the COP24 I have been invited to speak in places like Panama, New York, San Francisco, Abu Dhabi, Vancouver, British Virgin Islands...
But sadly our remaining carbon budget will not allow any such travels. 
My generation won’t be able to fly other than for emergencies in a foreseeable future, if we are to be the least bit serious about the 1,5 degree warming limit. Why? Because adult generations in countries like mine have used up our resources.

I will try to make it to as many places as possible without flying. And also participate via video link. 
And of course stop flying and go vegan alone is not the solution. 
We have to aim for a zero carbon lifestyle as soon as possible. Political decisions are necessary. But as they do not exist yet we have to do what we can ourselves to make the political movement come alive. (Photo by Anders Hellberg)
#istayontheground #govegan 
#slowtravel

I am honoured to be nominated for the #childrensclimateprize . I have read about the finalists, and they are all incredible, real heroes!They certainly deserve the prize more than I do.
But the idea that all the finalists are to be flown in from all over the world, to be a part of a ceremony, has no connection with reality. Our generation will never be able to fly(among other things), other than for emergencies. Because the adult generations have used up all our budget, our recourses. 
If we are to take the #ipcc ’s latest report even the least bit serious, we must immediately start acting as if we were in the crisis that we are in. And the least we can do, starting today, is to stay on the ground, stop eating meat and dairy and to promote a worldwide shop stop movement. 
Being nominated for, winning and handing out prizes is very nice, and I am truly grateful, but there’s unfortunately nothing nice with the ongoing sustainability crisis. 
You can of course argue from countless perspectives whether events like these do more good than bad. 
But from a carbon budget perspective, the question is black or white. 
So I no longer wish to be one of the finalists. Thank you. Greta.

locationName: Hoyer Autohof Hamburg Süd In Rade

firstComment:
This is Moorburg. 
It’s a coal power plant. 
It belongs the Swedish state owned Vattenfall. 
It belongs to everyone in Sweden. 
It belongs to me. 
My coal power plant is “environmentally friendly” according to my company’s web site. 
We have known the facts of climate change for more than 30 years. And yet my country - who call itself the most progressive country for the climate - opened Moorburg in 2015...
Today we use 100 million barrels of oil every day. There are no rules to keep that oil in the ground. 
There are no rules to shut down coal powerplants. 
So we can’t save the world by playing by the rules. Because the rules have to be changed. 
Everything needs to change. 
And it has to start today. #climatestrike #fridaysforfuture  #klimatstrejk
Thank you everyone who came to Rise For Climate in Brussels today!! Full speech will be up online in a couple of days... #climatestrike #riseforclimate #fridaysforfuture #klimatstrejk

Hi!
On Saturday I will participate in Rise For Climate (12.00), outside the EU-parliament in Brussels.
Since I don’t fly (for the climate) I will not be able to be in Stockholm for the school strike, on Friday.
 Instead I will sit with my fellow strikers outside the parliament in The Hague tomorrow. 
So it would be good if as many as possible would sit with my friends in Stockholm (8-15)! #climatestrike #fridaysforfuture #klimatstrejk 
On the picture you can see me, in front of the coal power plant Moorburg today, in Hamburg. That coal power plant is owned by the Swedish state owned Vattenfall. On their website they call it “environmentally friendly”. So much for being an environmental role model.

Interview by Masha Gessen in the Newyorker.
But in the text, Karin Bäckstrand says Sweden’s emissions have gone down by 26% since 1990. This is not true. If we take into account ALL of our emissions, we have seen no reduction since 1990 in Sweden’s emissions. As Kevin Anderson explains here. https://urplay.se/program/206482-ur-samtiden-klimatriksdagen-2018-var-star-vi-idag 
And this is exactly why I am school striking. Because almost everyone is telling lies and using convenient accounting instead of taking action. #climatestrike #fridaysforfuture  link in profile

‪Skolstrejk dag 3. 
Tydligen är det massa nazister och högerextrema som är arga för att media inte berättar om min familj. Så varsågoda:‬ Min mormor är diakon i svenska kyrkan. Min farfar är Bamse. Min morfar är ekonom. Min farmor är Reines mamma i Tre Kronor och min mamma heter Malena Ernman. ‪Själv heter jag Greta, jag är femton år och har Aspergers. Och jag skolstrejkar för klimatet. För om vi inte agerar nu så finns det väldigt snart ingen framtid kvar för min eller några kommande generationer. ‬
‪Så dom kan fortsätta kalla mig förståndshandikappad, utvecklingsstörd, terrorist, barnsoldat, psykiskt sjuk och mediakåt horunge hur mycket dom vill. Klimatet är faktiskt det enda som betyder nånting. Fixar vi inte det nu så spelar inget annat nån roll. ‬
#klimat #klimatstrejk 
PS. Kom sitt med oss! Alla är välkomna, man får komma och gå som man vill!

Day 1 of striking at Parliament House of Victoria.

The outcome of the election was disappointing, to say the least. 
A coal-loving Prime Minister, and a government full of climate-change denying MPs that refuse to take any meaningful action on climate change, have been re-elected. 
The School Strike 4 Climate team is heartbroken. For another three years, we can expect to see a continued disregard for our future, and profit being prioritised, by our government. 
However, this is not over and let’s make sure the LNP can’t spend a single second of their time in government avoiding the issue of climate change.

We will grow bigger, we will improve and we will fight tooth and nail before we let our climate be destroyed. 
Let’s do this. -

Tag your friends and let’s make our next action beyond massive. Watch this space for updates, and take care of yourselves ❤️❤️❤️❤️

• Jess Timms
•16 • Adelaide School Striker

Climate change does not discriminate. It’s a universal problem with universal repercussions. 
Everyday we are faced with more global issues directly correlated with climate change. Everyday we wake up to a slightly more chaotic world. Instead of being disheartened by this I decided to use it as motivation,because what good is a fire without fuel? 
Everyday youth are discouraged from speaking out, having a voice and making an impact. But in only one day, a school strike and a bunch of high school kids showed the power of youth action and the mountains we can move together. This inspired me go further and try harder to make progress against climate change.

Because together we stand united. United against the criticism, united against the world-wide catastrophe that is global warming. While we cannot change what our ancestors did, we can change the world future generations wake up to. And that gives me hope.

Today Sydney strikers met with the office of Tanya Plibersek, deputy leader of the labor party to discuss our demands for the climate policy we need. We’re looking forward to hearing back from her by March 8th!

The house is on fire.

“The global climate crisis that we are in is an issue with a ticking clock — and the fact that our adults and politicians are NOT doing enough, is, simply put, repulsive. Personally, I feel responsible to just do something. If striking from school is the only form of action that will gain the attention and consideration of our Parliament, then so be it. Join me in showing our politicians the passion of this country’s youth this March 15!”

•Anthony James
•18
•Melbourne School Striker •
“When I went to the first strike I had only recently finished my last year 12 exam. I was completely new to the movement. I had done very little activism, very little to bolster climate action forward. But after that day, I looked around and saw thousands of students shouting for something they cared about. But, I could vote, having only recently turned 18, whereas they couldn’t. The power of my one vote was worth more than the hearts and minds of thousands of school children. It’s an injustice of our democracy that the generation most hurt by the decisions of today, have no voice in those decisions. I could not stand idly, as the clock ticks down. Children starting in Prep and Year 1 will have had their future irreversibly taken away from them before they had the chance to vote. So, it feels like a duty on my end, to make my voice heard and my vote count so that those who are kept silent can have at least one person supporting their future.”

@alaterasoscar03 spent the first day of February protesting on Melbourne’s Parliament steps to demand climate action from our government. This movement is growing stronger and stronger every day.
#fridaysforfuture #schoolstrike4climate #climateaction
Stand up for what we deserve. Stand up for our world. March 15th.

Maiysha Moin
17, Melbourne School Striker •
“What drives me to lead this climate movement is that at the age of 30, when I have kids who are suffering the impacts of climate change, I don't want to look them in the eye and say that we had the ability to stop this crisis but we didn't. I want to tell them that we chose what was right, rather than what was easy.”

SS4C is a movement built on the support of hundreds of students. Their passion and drive to ensure that young Australians from all over the country are heard is seen in the countless hours of work they do. Whether they are organising the logistical elements of the strike, creating content for social media, or simply pitching in a great idea, every volunteer is appreciated. To show our love for them, we're showcasing the faces behind the movement in a new series called Climate Voices. Inspired by the amazing @OurClimateVoices on instagram.

Double page spread in The Age newspaper today! 🏆 👏 🏆 
Here is a snippet:

Lucie Atkin-Bolton, 11, who will soon graduate as school captain at Sydney's Forest Lodge Public School, says Australia should be sourcing 100 per cent of its electricity from solar power: "I can't understand why it hasn't been done yet." "Right now the political leaders aren’t doing very much at all," Lucie says. "They’re more promoting coal-sourced energy when, if we really want to have a better planet Earth, we need renewable energy." Climate change "is a crisis", she says. "It’s not going to happen in two or three decades - it’s happening now." Lucie says "whole islands will disappear" as warming lifts sea levels, and the time for thinking is running out. "We can’t just talk about it, we have to act," she says. "We have to make a change."
.

We are in the Sunday paper today! Here’s a photo from the newspaper. We already know fossil fuels are destroying our future. We are temporarily giving up a day of school to safeguard our future. 💪🏼 #climatestrike #schoolstrike4climate #climatechange #climateaction

Story time! "My eleven-year-old daughter Naomi is in year six at Goomalling Primary School. She’s too young for a social media account, but she let me tweet today about her climate action, and is OK with me telling you here about what she’s been up to. 
Her awesome teacher has been taking his year six students to local Council meetings for a taste of their local democracy. Each month, the students discuss an issue with Council. Kudos to Council for welcoming this!

On Wednesday, Naomi told Council that children all around Australia will be going on strike on 30 November, joining children all over the world who are encouraging their leaders to take urgent action to avert the worst of climate change.

She told them how the Goldilocks age - not too hot, not too cold, but just right - has been perfect for civilisation to thrive, but human activity releasing heat-trapping gases is warming the world and causing climate change, and so we have to reduce emissions.

She asked how Council feels about climate change. The answers included that it won’t get too bad, there are good things happening, and individual actions count. Naomi has been taking individual action most of her life, and thinks that it’s more important that people act together as a group, with industries and government leading, and feels that a lot of grownups don't understand the seriousness of the situation.

I’m letting Naomi strike next Friday. We are close enough to Perth to be able to attend Parliament House. Naomi’s teacher will be doing some climate activities with the kids back at school.

We are both part of Farmers for Climate Action and want to share the FCA's #Paws4Climate campaign." 🐝 🐞 🌲 🐜 🐑 
Thanks for your gorgeous story and design work Christie, Naomi (and Naomi's wonderful teacher) .

Meet siblings Nia and Iolo Cornthwaite. They won’t be at school next Wednesday because there is a #ClimateEmergency and they plan to go on #ClimateStrike along with hundreds, maybe thousands of kids around Australia. "I think that education is important, but what's even more important is making sure that we try and do something about climate change," Nia, 10, said of her motivations for participating in the Parliament House protest. "There are ways that we can do that, by helping create new models of electric cars and not adding to the greenhouse gas levels. It really is just small things that we can do in our community, which can make a big difference." Iolo, 11, hoped the protest would pressure politicians into fast-tracking the transition to a 100 per cent renewable energy market. "We just really want to try and get the message out that there is a future and we want it to be a great future," Iolo said. "We want lots of green, not just a world of rising seas and tornadoes." The siblings' involvement in the protest has the blessing of their mother, Shilo Preston-Stanley, who said peaceful protest was an important means for young people to communicate their concerns.

#ClimateStrike Call-out Challenge for students.
.
Take a selfie with #ClimateStrike written on your hands or a combination of hands (be creative!)
.
👉 Post on all your social media channels and include in the caption:
.
1. Why you're going on strike, and the urgent need for climate action
2. When and where you're gathering on the strike day.
3. Tag 1-2 people you want to protect from climate change and nominate them to join the strike with you
4. Challenge them to take this challenge and also put a call out to their friends to #ClimateStrike!

STORY TIME! While we were striking last Friday in Bendigo, a man came to see us because he heard us on the ABC. He said he thought he’d come down and buy us a coffee.“Oh, there’s a lot of you”, he said. “And we don’t all drink coffee” we told him. So he gave us $100 to buy hot chocolate and doughnuts and we gave him the change. Striking for our planet isn't all bad. 😍❤️🍦 #ClimateStrike #SchoolStrike #StopAdani #FridaysForFuture #KeepItInTheGround #BeyondCoal
